REG.question: Which region do you live in?

CIUDAD.question: In which city is the interview taking place?

TAMCIUD.question: What is the size of the respondent's habitat?

S1.question: What is your religion, if any?

values.12: Believer, but not affiliated with a church

S2.question: People sometimes describe themselves as belonging to a social class. Which class would you say you belong to?

S7.question: What ethnicity or race do you identify with most closely?

S9.description: Household head and main income contributor
S9.question: Are you the main contributor to your family's income or the head of the household?

S10.description: Age at which full-time education ended
S10.question: At what age did you complete your full-time education?

S11.description: Respondent's highest level of education completed
S11.question: What is the highest level of education you have completed?

values.16: Incomplete technical studies at a higher institute or academy
values.17: Complete technical studies at a higher institute or academy

S12.description: Parents' highest level of education completed
S12.question: What is the highest level of education either of your parents completed?

values.16: Incomplete technical studies at a higher institute or academy
values.17: Complete technical studies at a higher institute or academy

S16.question: Are you a citizen of this country?

S18.A.question: What is your current employment situation?

values.6: Not working – responsible for housework or shopping

S18.B.question: What was your previous employment situation?

S19.question: What type of work do you currently do?

S21A.description: Age at which the head of household completed full-time education
S21A.question: At what age did the head of your household complete their full-time education?

S21B.description: Head of household's highest level of education
S21B.question: What is the highest level of education completed by the head of your household?

values.16: Incomplete technical studies at higher institute or academy
values.17: Complete technical studies at higher institute or academy

S22.A.description: Current employment situation of head of household
S22.A.question: What is the current employment situation of the head of your household?

values.6: Not working – responsible for housework or shopping

S22.B.description: Previous employment situation of head of household
S22.B.question: What was the previous employment situation of the head of your household?

S23.description: Type of employment of head of household
S23.question: What type of work does the head of your household currently do?

S24.description: Assessed socioeconomic level of the interviewee
S24.question: Based on the quality of the dwelling, furniture, and the interviewee's general appearance, how would you rate the interviewee's socioeconomic level?

REEDUC.1.description: Recoded education level of the respondent (from S11)
REEDUC.1.question: What is the respondent's recoded education level?

REEDUC.2.description: Recoded education level of respondent's parents (from S12)
REEDUC.2.question: What is the recoded education level of the respondent's parents?

REEDUC.3.description: Recoded education level of head of household (from S21B)
REEDUC.3.question: What is the recoded education level of the head of household?

REEDAD.question: Which age group do you belong to?

S6.question: Are you or someone in your family receiving support or benefits from the government?

values.2: Yes, a family member is receiving support
values.3: Yes, both I and a family member are receiving support
values.4: No, we are not receiving any support

P62N.16.question: How would you rate Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva (Lula) overall?

P30STIN.A.description: Fear of job loss to automation
P30STIN.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that robots will take your job within the next ten years?

P30INN.F.description: Importance of technical skills for employment
P30INN.F.question: Do you agree or disagree that learning mathematics, engineering, or programming is important for getting a good job?

P36ST.description: Priority between climate action and economic growth
P36ST.question: Which of the following comes closer to your view about national priorities?

values.1: Priority should be given to fighting climate change, even if it affects economic growth
values.2: Priority should be given to economic growth, even if it affects the fight against climate change

P54ST.B.description: Belief in the market economy as the path to development
P54ST.B.question: Do you agree or disagree that a market economy is the only way your country can achieve development?

P10STGBS.description: Attitudes toward democracy and alternative regimes
P10STGBS.question: What is your general attitude toward democracy compared to other forms of government?

values.1: Democracy is preferable to any other kind of government
values.2: Under some circumstances, an authoritarian government can be preferable to a democratic one
values.3: For people like me, it doesn't matter whether we have a democratic or non-democratic regime

P18ST.A.description: Attitude toward democracy despite its problems
P18ST.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy may have problems but it is the best system of government?

P18STM.B.description: Acceptance of undemocratic government if it solves problems
P18STM.B.question: Do you agree or disagree that an undemocratic government is acceptable if it can solve the country's problems?

P18STM.C.description: Acceptance of media control by the president in times of difficulty
P18STM.C.question: Do you agree or disagree that in difficult times, it is acceptable for the president to control the media?

P18N.D.description: Support for diversity of media sources in democracy
P18N.D.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy requires a diversity of sources in the media?

P18N.E.question: Do you agree or disagree that the judiciary must be independent from the executive power?

P18N.F.question: Do you agree or disagree that political parties in your country work well?

P18N.G.description: Skepticism about hard-handed governments solving problems
P18N.G.question: Do you agree or disagree that even a hard-handed government would not be able to solve the country's problems?

P16ST.question: In politics, people often talk about 'left' and 'right'. Where would you place yourself on this scale?

P18ST.I.description: Belief in democracy's ability to solve problems
P18ST.I.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy makes it possible to solve the problems the country faces?

P20STM.description: Support for military government in difficult times
P20STM.question: Would you support a military government replacing the democratic government if the situation becomes very difficult?

values.1: Yes, I would support a military government
values.2: No, I would not support a military government under any circumstance

P21ST.description: Role of political parties in democracy
P21ST.question: Do you believe that democracy can function without political parties?

values.1: No — democracy cannot function without political parties
values.2: Yes — democracy can work without parties

P34WVSNA.question: Which of the following do you think is the most important priority for the country?

values.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

P34WVSNB.question: Which of the following do you think is the second most important priority for the country?

values.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

P35NA.description: Most important principle for good governance
P35NA.question: Which of the following do you think is most important for the best way to govern a country?

values.1: Concentrating political power in one leader
values.3: Ensuring the media does not question those in power

P35NB.description: Second most important principle for good governance
P35NB.question: Which of the following do you think is second most important for the best way to govern a country?

values.1: Concentrating political power in one leader
values.3: Ensuring the media does not question those in power

P46N.description: Views on freedom of expression vs. fake news control
P46N.question: Do you think it is more important to protect freedom of expression even if it allows fake news, or to control fake news even if it limits freedom of expression?

values.1: Freedom of expression should be guaranteed, even if it means fake news circulates
values.2: Fake news should be controlled, even if it limits freedom of expression

P23ST.A.question: What is your overall opinion of the United States?

P23ST.B.question: What is your overall opinion of Russia?

P23ST.D.question: What is your overall opinion of the European Union?

P23ST.E.question: What is your overall opinion of Ukraine?

P23ST.F.question: What is your overall opinion of Venezuela?

P24ST.A.question: How would you rate the relationship between your country and the United States?

P24ST.B.question: How would you rate the relationship between your country and Russia?

P24ST.C.question: How would you rate the relationship between your country and China?

P24ST.D.description: Bilateral relations: Country and the European Union
P24ST.D.question: How would you rate the relationship between your country and the European Union?

P24ST.E.question: How would you rate the relationship between your country and Venezuela?

P25N.A.question: How would you rate the economic relationship between your country and the United States?

P25N.B.question: How would you rate the economic relationship between your country and Russia?

P25N.C.question: How would you rate the economic relationship between your country and China?

P26SDN.A.description: Perception of China as a reliable partner
P26SDN.A.question: How much do you think China is a reliable partner for your country?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P26SDN.B.question: How much do you think China interferes in your country's internal affairs?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P26SDN.C.description: Perception of China's respect for international commitments
P26SDN.C.question: How much do you think China upholds its international commitments?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P26SDN.D.description: Perception of China's contribution to regional stability
P26SDN.D.question: How much do you think China contributes to stability in Latin America?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P26SDN.E.description: Perception of China as a political model
P26SDN.E.question: How much do you think China provides a good political model for your country?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P26SDN.F.description: Perception of China as an economic model
P26SDN.F.question: How much do you think China provides a good economic model for your country?

values.3: Not very much / Only a little

P27SDN.question: If you could only choose one, should your country have a closer relationship with the United States or with China?

P28STIN.question: In the last five years, do you think your country's integration with other countries in the region has increased or decreased?

P29STIN.A.description: Support for integration with Latin American countries
P29STIN.A.question: Do you support or oppose your country's integration with other countries in Latin America?

P29STIN.B.description: Support for integration with non–Latin American countries
P29STIN.B.question: Do you support or oppose your country's integration with countries outside Latin America?

P31INN.1.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: full set of areas
P31INN.1.question: Which of the following areas do you think depend on your country integrating with other countries?

values.1: Being able to study or work in another country
values.2: Being able to buy foreign products at lower prices
values.5: Access to a wider variety of goods
values.6: More and better access to technology

P31INN.2.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: subset without studying/working abroad
P31INN.2.question: Which of the following outcomes do you think depend on your country integrating with other countries?

values.2: Being able to buy foreign products at lower prices
values.5: Access to a wider variety of goods
values.6: More and better access to technology

P31INN.3.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: subset starting from job creation
P31INN.3.question: Which of these areas do you think depend on your country integrating with other countries?

values.5: Access to a wider variety of goods
values.6: More and better access to technology

P31INN.4.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: subset focused on income and access
P31INN.4.question: Which of these areas do you think depend on your country integrating with other countries?

values.5: Access to a wider variety of goods
values.6: More and better access to technology

P31INN.5.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: variety of goods and technology
P31INN.5.question: Which of these areas do you think depend on your country integrating with other countries?

values.5: Access to a wider variety of goods
values.6: More and better access to technology

P31INN.6.description: Perceived benefits of international integration: only technology access
P31INN.6.question: Do you think better access to technology depends on your country integrating with other countries?

values.6: More and better access to technology

P49ST.description: Perceived risk of expressing political opinions
P49ST.question: If you express your opinions freely and publicly about national problems, do you think it could have negative consequences for you?

P41ST.A.question: To what extent do you think freedom of political participation is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.B.question: To what extent do you think freedom to choose one's occupation is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.C.question: To what extent do you think environmental protection is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.D.description: Perceived guarantee of private property protection
P41ST.D.question: To what extent do you think private property is protected in your country?

P41ST.E.description: Perceived guarantee of fair wealth distribution
P41ST.E.question: To what extent do you think there is a just and fair distribution of wealth in your country?

P41ST.F.question: To what extent do you think equality between men and women is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.G.description: Perceived equality of opportunity regardless of origin
P41ST.G.question: To what extent do you think people have equal life chances regardless of their origin in your country?

P41ST.H.description: Perceived guarantee of freedom of speech
P41ST.H.question: To what extent do you think freedom of speech is guaranteed always and everywhere in your country?

P41ST.I.description: Perceived guarantee of freedom of religion
P41ST.I.question: To what extent do you think freedom of religion or faith is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.J.description: Perceived guarantee of protection against crime
P41ST.J.question: To what extent do you think people are protected against crime in your country?

P41ST.K.question: To what extent do you think social security is guaranteed in your country?

P41ST.L.description: Perceived guarantee of solidarity with the poor and needy
P41ST.L.question: To what extent do you think there is solidarity with the poor and needy in your country?

P41ST.M.description: Perceived chance to get a job
P41ST.M.question: To what extent do you think people have a fair chance to get a job in your country?

P2ST.question: What is your opinion on the current direction in which the country is heading?

P3N.question: What is your opinion about the current state of national society?

values.1: It is all right as it is
values.2: It can get better with small changes

P4STGBS.description: Most important problem facing the country
P4STGBS.question: What do you think is the most important problem currently facing the country?

values.39: Not being able to be in my country
values.40: Lack of concern for the elderly

P11STGBS.A.description: Satisfaction with the functioning of democracy
P11STGBS.A.question: How satisfied are you with the way democracy works in your country?

P12ST.description: Perception of who governs the country
P12ST.question: In your opinion, is the country governed primarily by powerful groups serving their own interests, or is it governed for the good of all citizens?

values.1: Powerful groups in their own interest

P17ST.question: How fair do you think the distribution of income is in your country?

P63ST.description: Perceived likelihood of a coup occurring
P63ST.question: How likely do you think it is that a coup could occur in your country, or do you not know enough to say?

P5STGBS.description: Perception of the country's current economic situation
P5STGBS.question: How would you describe the country's current economic situation?

P6STGBS.description: Change in the country's economic situation over the past 12 months
P6STGBS.question: Compared to 12 months ago, how would you describe the country's current economic situation?

P7ST.description: Expectations for the country's economic situation in the next 12 months
P7ST.question: Over the next 12 months, how do you expect the country's economic situation to change compared to now?

P8STGBS.description: Expectations for personal and family economic situation in the next 12 months
P8STGBS.question: Over the next 12 months, how do you expect your and your family's economic situation to change compared to now?

P11STGBS.B.question: How satisfied are you with the current state of the economy in your country?

P13ST.D.question: How much trust do you have in the National Congress or Parliament?

P14ST.H.question: How much trust do you have in the printed press?

P14N.I.question: How much trust do you have in social media platforms?

P40STGBS.question: How interested are you in politics?

P54N.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that protests are a legitimate way to express political demands?

PERPART.description: Type of political party supported by respondent
PERPART.question: What type of political party does the respondent support?

FAMPART.description: Type of political party supported by respondent's family
FAMPART.question: What type of political party does the respondent's family support?

values.0: No vote / null vote / no party

P42STGBS.description: Feeling of closeness to a political party
P42STGBS.question: Do you feel close to any political party?

P43STGBS.A.description: Voting intention if elections were held this Sunday
P43STGBS.A.question: If elections were held this Sunday, which political party would you vote for?

P44ST.A.description: Frequency of political conversations with friends
P44ST.A.question: How often do you talk about politics with friends?

P44ST.B.description: Frequency of working on community problems
P44ST.B.question: How often do you work on a problem that affects you or your community?

P44ST.C.description: Frequency of trying to persuade others of political views
P44ST.C.question: How often do you try to convince others of your political views?

P44ST.D.description: Frequency of working for a political party or candidate
P44ST.D.question: How often do you work for a political party or candidate?

P45ST.A.question: Have you ever signed a petition, would you do it, or would you never do it?

P45S.B.question: Have you ever taken part in an authorized demonstration, would you do it, or would you never do it?

P45ST.C.question: Have you ever taken part in a non-authorized demonstration, would you do it, or would you never do it?

P45STN.D.question: Have you ever protested on social media, would you do it, or would you never do it?

P50ST.description: Channels for expressing opinions on national problems
P50ST.question: Where do you usually express your opinions about national problems, or do you not usually express them?

values.5: I usually do not express them

P47ST.question: What do you think one should do to help your country move forward?

values.2: One must vote and also protest
values.3: One must only protest — voting is no good
values.4: One must do nothing — neither vote nor protest
values.5: I do not know what to do

P30INN.D.description: Perception of gender inequality in business
P30INN.D.question: Do you agree or disagree that men have a considerable advantage over women when starting a business?

P30INN.E.description: Preference for products produced by women
P30INN.E.question: Do you agree or disagree that you prefer to buy products made by women over those made by men?

P33N.A.description: Perception of immigrants' impact on the economy
P33N.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that immigrants are good for the country's economy?

P33ST.B.description: Perception of immigrants as job competitors
P33ST.B.question: Do you agree or disagree that immigrants come to compete for jobs?

P33N.C.description: Perception of immigrants and crime rates
P33N.C.question: Do you agree or disagree that immigrants increase crime rates?

P33N.D.question: Do you agree or disagree that immigrants improve our society with new ideas and culture?

P37CSN.A.description: Support for adoption rights for same-sex couples
P37CSN.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that same-sex couples should be allowed to adopt children?

P37CSN.B.question: Do you agree or disagree that marriage between people of the same sex should be allowed?

P37STCS.C.description: Belief that women should stay at home and men should work
P37STCS.C.question: Do you agree or disagree that it is better for women to concentrate on the home and for men to work outside?

P37WVSSTCS.D.description: Belief that men are better political leaders
P37WVSSTCS.D.question: Do you agree or disagree that men are better political leaders than women?

P37STCS.E.description: Belief that a woman earning more than a man causes trouble
P37STCS.E.question: Do you agree or disagree that when a woman earns more than a man, it almost certainly causes problems?

P37CSN.F.description: Support for legal recognition of gender change on ID documents
P37CSN.F.question: Do you agree or disagree that a person's gender change should be legally recognized on identity documents?

P37WVSCS.G.description: Belief that men should have job priority during scarcity
P37WVSCS.G.question: Do you agree or disagree that when jobs are scarce, men should have more right to a job than women?

P37WVSCS.H.description: Belief that same-sex couples are equally good parents
P37WVSCS.H.question: Do you agree or disagree that homosexual couples are just as good parents as heterosexual couples?

P38CSN.1.description: Support for various gender, family, and reproductive policies (full set)
P38CSN.1.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.1: Maternity leave should be available for both mothers and fathers
values.2: Women should have a reserved quota of executive jobs in private companies
values.3: Women should have a reserved quota of executive jobs in the public sector
values.4: Schools should provide young people with access to birth control methods
values.5: Abortion should be legal in cases of rape or incest
values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.2.description: Support for gender, education, and family policies (subset)
P38CSN.2.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.2: Women should have a reserved quota of executive jobs in private companies
values.3: Women should have a reserved quota of executive jobs in the public sector
values.4: Schools should provide young people with access to birth control methods
values.5: Abortion should be legal in cases of rape or incest
values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.3.description: Support for public sector gender quotas and family policies
P38CSN.3.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.3: Women should have a reserved quota of executive jobs in the public sector
values.4: Schools should provide young people with access to birth control methods
values.5: Abortion should be legal in cases of rape or incest
values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.4.description: Support for education, abortion rights, and family policies
P38CSN.4.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.4: Schools should provide young people with access to birth control methods
values.5: Abortion should be legal in cases of rape or incest
values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.5.description: Support for abortion rights and family care policies
P38CSN.5.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.5: Abortion should be legal in cases of rape or incest
values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.6.description: Support for workplace childcare and old-age pensions for women
P38CSN.6.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

values.6: Companies should offer either subsidies or facilities to care for workers' children
values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

P38CSN.7.description: Support for solidarity pensions for older women without a pension
P38CSN.7.question: Do you agree or disagree that women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age?

values.7: Women without a pension should receive a solidarity pension in old age

S8.question: Have you or your family ever considered moving to live abroad?

P9STGBS.question: To what extent do you feel that most people can be trusted, or that you need to be cautious when dealing with others?

values.2: One can never be too careful in dealing with others

P48ST.description: Perception of honesty in political expression
P48ST.question: Do you think most people say what they really think about politics, or not?

values.1: They say what they think about politics
values.2: They usually do not say what they really think

P19N.question: Do you agree or disagree that society should be open to a diversity of traditions and habits?

values.1: Disagree — society should defend its own traditions and habits
values.2: Agree — society should be open to a diversity of traditions and habits

S1A.question: How would you describe your level of religious devotion?

P61ST.question: How acceptable do you think the current level of inequality is in your country?

P22ST.question: To what extent do you think it is justifiable or unjustifiable to evade paying taxes?

P1ST.question: How satisfied are you with your life in general?

S3.description: Experience of food insecurity in the past year
S3.question: In the past 12 months, how often have you or your family gone without food?

S4.description: Concern about unemployment in the next 12 months
S4.question: How concerned are you that you will be left without work or become unemployed in the next 12 months, or do you not currently have a job?

values.5: Do not have a job (e.g., unemployed, student, housewife, retired)

S5.question: Does your salary and total family income allow you to cover your needs in a satisfactory manner?

values.2: It's just enough, we don't have major problems
values.3: It's not enough, we have problems
values.4: It's not enough, we have major problems

P57ST.1.description: Perceived most frequent type of violence in local area (full set)
P57ST.1.question: Which type of violence do you think is most frequent where you live?

values.7: State or police violence and abuse

P57ST.2.description: Perceived most frequent type of violence (excluding bullying)
P57ST.2.question: Among these, which type of violence do you think is most frequent where you live?

values.7: State or police violence and abuse

P57ST.3.description: Perceived most frequent violence (subset starting from domestic violence against women)
P57ST.3.question: Which type of violence do you think is most frequent where you live?

values.7: State or police violence and abuse

P57ST.4.description: Perceived most frequent violence (starting from street violence)
P57ST.4.question: Which type of violence do you think is most frequent where you live?

values.7: State or police violence and abuse
